channel.title: 1 Introduction on Kakip Techdoc
channel.description: Recent content in 1 Introduction on Kakip Techdoc

item.title: 1.1 Overview
item.description: Kakip is based on the Renesas RZ/V2H processor. It features a quad-core Cortex-A55 CPU subsystem at 1.1GHz for system control, Cortex-R8 Dual subsystem for low-latency I/O and control, Coretx-M33, with 80TOPS AI Accelerator, DRP-AI3 and dynamically reconfigurable processor(DRP). Core Processor: Renesas “RZ/V2H” In the development of next-generation robots, a sophisticated fusion of the brain and the physical is essential. The core processor “RZ/V2H” in Kakip has a multi-core configuration with three different CPUs that can simultaneously realize brain-side processing with Linux (AI image processing with DRP-AI3 and Open CV acceleration with DRP), physical control with RTOS, and I/O control.

item.title: 1.2 Features
item.description: CPU Cortex-A55 Quad 1.1GHz / Cortex-R8 Dual 800MHz / Cortex-M33 200MHz Multi-core CPU configuration enables various OS controls such as coexistence with R0S2 or RTOS. Powerful CPU cores are ideal for robots that perform complex tasks. Three cores with different performance enable different applications to be built in each. NPU DRP-AI3 (INT8) / DRP (STP4) The latest “DRP-Al3” with excellent power performance (TOPS/W base) provides powerful Al image processing. DRP is also equipped, enabling efficient offloading of OpenCV and other inference image processing.

item.title: 1.3 Mechanical Specifications
item.description: Dimansion: L89 mm x W58 mm x H20 mm Weight: Dimensions
